awd_abstract_narration: This grant supports an international and interdisciplinary forum for            the exchange of research by and for representatives of Inuit                    communities and researchers and scholars principally from the U.S.,             Canada, Greenland, Denmark, and the USSR.  The Conference theme                 "Looking to the Future" focuses on current cultural and social changes          facing northern and indigenous communities.  This is the first time             the biennially convened Conference will be held in the United States,           is expected to attract more than 400 participants and will have over 80         presenters.  The Conference and its proceedings will enhance                    international cooperation among arctic nations and its people.  Agency          funding of this Conference directly supports the intent of the Arctic           Research and Policy Act of 1984 and provides the opportunity for the            National Science Foundation to develop the objectives of its recently           approved Arctic Social Science Research Program.
